snippet: In a school district 90 minutes north of New York City, Jewish families have filed a lawsuit seeking damages and policies to end what it calls pervasive anti-Semitism in the schools.
abstract: Three Jewish families in Pine Bush Central School District in Upstate New York file lawsuit against district and its administration, seeking damages and an end to what they call pervasive anti-Semitism and indifference by school officials; district officials vigorously contest suit, denying incidents were widespread and saying administration had responded appropriately with discipline and other measures.

byline.contributor: Nate Schweber contributed reporting from Pine Bush, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: In a school district 90 minutes north of New York City, Jewish families have filed a lawsuit seeking damages and policies to end what it calls pervasive anti-Semitism in the schools.

headline.seo: Pine Bush, N.Y., School District Faces Accusations of Anti-Semitism
headline.main: Swastikas, Slurs and Torment in Town’s Schools
headline.print_headline: Swastikas, Slurs and Torment in Town’s Schools
